question_content.barrons:question:
The auctioneer prided himself on his imperturbability under the most hectic of circumstances; no matter how

(i)________ the bidding became or how immensely precious the items he auctioned, he allowed nothing to

(ii)________ his composure.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
frenzied; unsettle.

Someone imperturbable is calm and composed. Even if the bidding at an auction became frenzied (frantic; highly agitated), that would not unsettle (ruffle; disturb) an imperturbable auctioneerâ€™s composure. Think of "unsettled sleep."

Magnanimous is incorrect. The bidding at an auction would be somewhat unlikely to be described as magnanimous (high-minded; noble).

Sporadic is incorrect. The key phrase here is the most hectic of circumstances. Sporadic (intermittent or infrequent) bidding would not be particularly hectic or frantic.

Ameliorate is incorrect. The auctioneer prides himself on his imperturbability, his ability to maintain his composure under stressful conditions. He will not allow anything to shake his composure. Ameliorate (improve; make better) makes no sense in the context.

Denigrate is incorrect. The auctioneer prides himself on his imperturbability, his ability to maintain his composure under stressful conditions. He will not allow anything to shake his composure. Denigrate (disparage; defame) makes no sense in the context.
